key.title: English key for the Platylabus species of the Western Palearctic region - Males
key.note: Unknown for P. ponticus , P. cabrerai , P. pullus and P. helveticus.

lead.property: Body metallic violett or blue (rarely darkened and copper-like).
Body black or black and red or yellow, without metallic shine.
Flagellum usually with less than 40 segments, Tyloids variable.
Temples strongly narrowed behind the eyes, sides straight or concave.
All tibiae and tarsi with ivory pattern.
Temples moderately and convexly narrowed behind the eyes.
Legs blue-black, femur I and tibia I ivory in front.
Head, mesosoma, metasoma, and legs largely reddish, sometimes body ± darkened, very rarely entirely black.
Thyridia much wider than their interval.
Metanotum sometimes with yellow spot centrally.
Head and mesosoma without reddish coloration.
Mesosoma black, with extensive yellow pattern, usually meso- and metapleurum with central yellow spots.
Mesosoma black, sometimes with ivory pattern, but without yellow spots in the center of meso- and metapleura.
Metasoma ± red, usually at least postpetiole, tergites 2 and 3.
Hypostomal carina strongly raised, usually higher than the width of the apical segment of maxillar palpi (except in P. borealis).
Metasoma black, tergites sometimes with small ivory or red apical margins, rarely tergite 2 ± red at base and apex.
Mesosoma entirely black, rarely apex of scutellum paler.
First flagellar segment very short, index about 2.5.
Hypostomal carina usually strongly raised, higher than the width of the apical segment of maxillar palpi.
Postpetiole moderately widened, its index not more than 0.75, dorsal carinae usually ± obsolete.
Interval between thyridiae usually not smaller than the middle field of postpetiole.
Temples weakly or moderately narrowed behind the eyes, Vertex sometimes with ivory spots, genae sometimes swollen.
Postpetiole strongly widened, its index at least 0.85, dorsal carinae strong.
Interval between thyridiae much smaller than the median field of postpetiole.
Temples strongly narrowed behind the eyes.
Temples moderately narrowed behind the eyes.
Vertex rarely with ivory spots, usually black.
Temples parallel or slightly narrowed behind the eyes.
Upper lateral margin of pronotum with ivory streak.
Epicnemium not raised behind coxa I.
Vertex usually without ivory spots (very rarely present).
Upper lateral margin of pronotum black, at most hind angle with ivory spots.
Epicnemium often somewhat raised behind coxa I.
Flagellum usually with ivory stripe, with 32-38 segments.
Flagellum with 34-38 segments, Tyloids obsolete or absent.
Hind angle or upper lateral margin of pronotum with ivory spot or line.
Facial orbits with small ivory stripes.
Temples strongly narrowed behind the eyes, with almost straight sides.
Face largely ivory, only a black longitudinal line in the middle of the face.
Temples strongly narrowed behind the eyes, but sides rounded.
Frons entirely smooth and shining, with scattered punctures.
Tibia III black, with or without ivory subbasal ring.
Genae less swollen or hypostomal carina strongly raised.
Tibia III without ivory subbasal ring.
Dorsal carinae of tergite 1 raised at the level of spiracles.
Face completely ivory or with a black longitudinal line in the middle.
Tibia III with a ivory subbasal ring (rarely obsolete).
Dorsal carinae of tergite 1 not conspicuously raised at the level of spiracles.
Femur III ± brown or black, at most reddish basally.
Femur III mostly red, often darkened apically.
Torulus on outer side with an ear-like extension.
Tubercle between toruli tooth-like, sublateral projection of metanotum tongue-like expanded.
Torulus on outer side not unusually expanded.
Tubercle between toruli smaller, sublateral projection of metanotum tooth-like.
Tyloids sometimes absent, flagellum often with fewer segments.
Upper lateral margin of pronotum black, rarely hind angle with ivory spots.
Temples slightly narrowed behind the eyes.
Upper lateral margin of pronotum ± ivory.
lead.note: [Some specimens of P. concinnus Thomson with ± black femur III key here, but body length 5-7 mm and flagellum with 32-35 segments]

lead.property: Last segment of tarsus III normal, not elongate.
Thyridia smaller, at most as wide as their interval.
Last segment of tarsus III elongate (as in Asthenolabus).
Ivory spots at vertex not confluent with ivory frontal orbits, at apex usually not medially extended.
Upper hind angle of mesopleurum without a clear yellow spot.
Basal tergites often with paler apical margins.
Lateral mesoscutal lobes with coarse punctures, intervals with fine microsculpture, ± shining.
Ivory spots at vertex confluent with ivory frontal orbits and at apex medially extended.
Upper hind angle of mesopleurum with a clear yellow spot.
Lateral mesoscutal lobes with finer punctures, intervals with dense microsculpture, usually ± dull.
Scutellum with ivory spot at apex, postscutellum black.
Upper lateral margin of pronotum with ivory stripe, rarely only hind angle ivory.
Upper lateral margin of pronotum usually black.
If hind angle or (very rarely) upper lateral margin ivory, than hypostomal carina strongly raised or lateral mesoscutal lobes with microsculpture centrally.
Area superomedia 2.5-3.0 times wider than long.
Frons almost smooth, with conspicuous but fine punctures.
Basal tergites with scattered punctures, partly with microsculpture, shining.
lead.note: (Some specimens of P. pallidens Wesmael with brown femur III key here: flagellum with 38-40 segments; also some dark specimens of P. rufus : thyridia very wide and flagellum with 34-36 segments.)

lead.property: Thyridia at least as wide as their interval.
Mesopleurum ventrally and mesosternum often with extended ivory pattern.
Petiole long, postpetiole almost smooth, shining, with scattered coarse punctures.
Thyridia as wide as their interval.
Coxa and trochanter I and II usually entirely ivory, coxa III with ivory spot.
Mesopleurum and mesosternum black, rarely with a small ivory streak at epicnemium.
Lateral mesoscutal lobes usually smooth and shining between punctures.
Petiole shorter, postpetiole without coarse punctures, aciculate or ± smooth.
Thyridia usually wider than their interval.
Coxae often with less extended ivory pattern.
Coxa and trochanter I and II ivory, coxa III ± reddish, ivory apically.
Coxa and trochanter often with less extended ivory pattern, coxa III ± black.
lead.note: The males of the following three species are not always separable morphologically.

lead.property: Area petiolaris usually with coarse but low rugulae, ± shining, sometimes almost smooth.
Femur III red, usually not or slightly darkened apically.
Area petiolaris usually aciculate and slightly shining or dull.
Hypostomal carina strongly raised, much wider than the apical segment of maxillary palp.
Hypostomal carina not or slightly raised, at most as wide as the apical segment of maxillary palp.
Temples somewhat enlarged or parallel behind the eyes, slighty narrowed apically.
Scutellum often with ivory spot apically.
lead.note: Due to large variations in sculpture and colour, the following species are not always separable.

lead.property: Epicnemium ventrally somewhat elevated, higher than at the mesopleurum, with small central notch.
Face often ± black centrally, with ivory facial orbits.
Lateral mesoscutal lobes with microsculpture in the central parts, but ± shining.
Pterostigma usually yellow-brown (rarely darker brown) in center.
Lateral mesoscutal lobes smooth in central parts, shining.
Lateral mesoscutal lobes with microsculpture or coriaceous between the punctures, ± dull.
Petiole slender, from base to spiracles about 3 times as long as wide.
Lateral mesoscutal lobes only partly with (or entirely without) microsculpture, shining.
If microsculpture stronger (in P. transversus ), then area superomedia very wide and/or petiole shorter.
Thyridia about as wide as their interval.
Last segment of tarsus III elongate.
Thyridia often wider than their interval.
Last segment of tarsus III not elongate.
Mesopleurum ventrally and mesosternum usually with ivory pattern.
Thyridia as wide as their interval.
Coxa and trochanter I-II usually entirely ivory, coxa III with ivory marks.
Coxa and trochanter not entirely ivory.
Flagellum less slender, often with ivory stripe, with 35-37 segments.
Flagellum more slender, often entirely black, with 37-40 segments.
Postpetiole and tergite 2 in the basal third rugulose.
Hind angles of pronotum often ivory.
Tibia III black. First flagellar segment short, index about 2.5.
Smaller, body length at most 9 mm.
Postpetiole with finer sculpture or smooth,
Tibia III mainly or entirely black, often with a red subbasal ring.
Tibia III largely red, darkened only in the apical half.
Tergite 2 with microsculpture, matte, length at least 0.80 times its width.
Tergite 2 almost smooth and shining, with scattered punctures, wider, length at most 0.70 times its width.
Tegulae and subalar ridge usually ivory.
Face entirely ivory. Mesosoma black, without ivory marks.
